title: ICE: use of a constant whose type is a projection inside a pattern: big_enum_set

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

body:
Found in the crater runs of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/72969 ```` git clone https://github.com/manuthambi/big_enum_set cd big_enum_set git checkout e0512c1032831cbc1efe6fd309f5743974780259 cargo test ```` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.46.0-nightly (feb3536eb 2020-06-09) binary: rustc commit-hash: feb3536eba10c2e4585d066629598f03d5ddc7c6 commit-date: 2020-06-09 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.46.0-nightly LLVM version: 10.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_mir_build/hair/pattern/const_to_pat.rs:137: use of a constant whose type is a projection inside a pattern thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:907:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.46.0-nightly (feb3536eb 2020-06-09) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental -C target-cpu=native note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden error: aborting due to previous error error: could not compile `big_enum_set`. To learn more, run the command again with --verbose ```
Backtrace

``` Compiling big_enum_set v0.2.0 (/tmp/big_enum_set/big_enum_set) error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_mir_build/hair/pattern/const_to_pat.rs:137: use of a constant whose type is a projection inside a pattern thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:907:9 stack backtrace: 0: backtrace::backtrace::libunwind::trace at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:59 4: core::fmt::write at src/libcore/fmt/mod.rs:1076 5: std::io::Write::write_fmt at src/libstd/io/mod.rs:1537 6: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:62 7: std::sys_common::backtrace::print at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:49 8: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}} at src/libstd/panicking.rs:198 9: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.46.0-nightly (feb3536eb 2020-06-09) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental -C target-cpu=native note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [check_match] match-checking `small_enum::match_const_test` #1 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error error: could not compile `big_enum_set`. To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
